result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.

11:42 AM Defendant Tory George Lysdahl appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case on for Status Conference.  No attorney has been assigned by the PD at this point.  Court recaps case.  Court amends bond to signature bond, $500 signature bond- same conditions.  Def requests Zoom from programming facility- if def proves he is in the programming facility, Court will allow def's Zoom appearance.  WTLPH.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.

The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.

2:46 PM Defendant Tory George Lysdahl appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def appears from Burnett County Jail.  Def waiting for PD to appoint.  Court reviews def's options for today's hearing.  Def wishes to move forward today.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Def enters NG plea to misdemeanor.  Court will allow def to argue for a bond modification.  Def asks for signature bond.  State asks to keep some cash- $500 or $250.  Court reduces to $250 cash.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.
